class Solution:
    def minimumCost(self, m: int, n: int, horizontalCut: List[int], verticalCut: List[int]) -> int:
        horizontalCut.sort(reverse=True)
        verticalCut.sort(reverse=True)
        h_ind = 0
        v_ind = 0
        cost = 0
        h_lines = 1
        v_lines = 1
        while h_ind < len(horizontalCut) and v_ind < len(verticalCut):
            if horizontalCut[h_ind] > verticalCut[v_ind]:
                cost += horizontalCut[h_ind] * h_lines
                v_lines += 1
                h_ind += 1
            else:
                cost += verticalCut[v_ind] * v_lines
                h_lines += 1
                v_ind += 1
        while h_ind < len(horizontalCut):
            cost += horizontalCut[h_ind] * h_lines
            h_ind += 1
        while v_ind < len(verticalCut):
            cost += verticalCut[v_ind] * v_lines
            v_ind += 1
        return cost
